comments.html:
OpenFlow is not just a flow programing, it came with hypervisor this time.
Like MPLS didn't fly untilll VPN/TE came up, may be this time is different? what you think :)

comments.name: igp2bgp

comments.html: Yup. Because paying for apps on network gear is so popular today. Moving from black boxes to the IT model of hardware and software will be a huge cultural shift over the next decade. IMHO.
comments.name: Abner Germanow

comments.html: To some degree we've already been here before.  I can imagine adding Openflow support to a centralized routing system like the Alcatel 5620 and reviving the past but this time with anyone's switch hardware.
comments.name: FullMesh
